definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
parazoan (animal of the subkingdom Parazoa, mostly sponges)
Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora/CITES
pinyin: Bin1 wei1 Ye3 sheng1 Dong4 Zhi2 wu4 zhong3 Guo2 ji4 Mao4 yi4 Gong1 yue1
containing_words.word: 濒危野生动植物种国际贸易公约

pinyin: ye3 sheng1 dong4 zhi2 wu4 yuan2

sentences.english: It is composed of hair follicle melanocytes are vivid.
sentences.chinese: 这是由毛囊中黑色素细胞不生动构成的。

sentences.english: Do not feed macaques and wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 请勿喂食猕猴及其它野生动物。

sentences.english: It's a good example of sort of real time and psychological time in music.
sentences.chinese: 这是音乐上的实际时间和心理时间的生动例子。

sentences.english: The forth episode of the coiled. riot, Eveline vividly demonstrates a kind of emotion paralysis in Dublin youngsters.
sentences.chinese: 生动地表现了都柏林青年人瘫痪的精神状态。

sentences.english: Lively and vivacious, Bettie was her father's favourite.
sentences.chinese: 生动而活泼，身心愉快是她父亲的喜爱。

sentences.english: The artist sketched in a few trees to show a vividness in its surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 画家粗略地添加了几棵树，使画面环境颇显生动。

sentences.english: Further, the compounds of the present invention have antiprotozoal properties.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本发明的化合物具有抗原生动物的性能。

sentences.english: When you do, be prepared for some intensive wildlife bingo.
sentences.chinese: 如果你来这里旅行，请注意野生动物密集的区域。

sentences.english: It has transparent cover which allows the kids to see the sea wild life.
sentences.chinese: 它有透明盖，让孩子们看海野生动物。

sentences.english: Eating wild animal, to maintain ecological balance.
sentences.chinese: 拒食野生动物，维护生态平衡。

sentences.english: You can just imagine how fierce the wild animals can be.
sentences.chinese: 你可以想象一下野生动物是多么的凶猛。

sentences.english: She is good at teaching and tries her best to make every lesson lively and interesting.
sentences.chinese: 她教得很好而且尽可能使每节课都上得生动有趣。

sentences.english: They vividly recall their own Kobe quake of 1995.
sentences.chinese: 他们还生动地回想起1995年的神户大地震。

sentences.english: We have books that are very interesting, that are very accessible.
sentences.chinese: 生动有趣，通俗易懂的书籍。

sentences.english: Finally those who hunt them must be punished severely.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对涌锒猎珍稀野生动物的人必须严惩。

sentences.english: The Moral Life of Animals is a pleasure to read.
sentences.chinese: 《动物的道德生活》读来生动有趣。

definition: living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
vivid/lively/(of food ingredients) live or fresh
vivid and lifelike (idiom); true to life/realistic
to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
